intro: Ptilotus disparilis, commonly known as the spinifex grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in compact inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Ptilotus disparilis is well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystem.
